snippet: Recent airstrikes that have left dozens dead, including more than 20 children, have raised calls for rapid and expanded efforts to address the growing humanitarian crisis.
abstract: Activists and international medical aid workers say Syrian warplanes have killed dozens of civilians, including more than 20 children, in intensifying campaign of anti-insurgency airstrikes across country; account is disputed by Syrian government.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, and Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Recent airstrikes that have left dozens dead, including more than 20 children, have raised calls for rapid and expanded efforts to address the growing humanitarian crisis.

headline.seo: Syria Launches Deadly Airstrikes in Damascus Suburbs
headline.main: Dozens of Civilians Are Said to Be Killed by Syrian Airstrikes
headline.print_headline: Dozens of Civilians Are Said to Be Killed by Syrian Airstrikes

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
